reviews.text: 1. Location. what gives it a good location is that it is near the Robinson's Manila Mall. actually, you can see the mall from the hotel. if you have been to this mall, you wouldn't want to go to some other malls because it's just too big and almost everything that you'll ever need is there.

the hotel is also close to the bay walk where you could stroll and run beside the sea. too bad the new mayor had all the nightlife removed there. the view of the bay especially at noon and dusk is truly amazing.
reviews.title: Nice room but very loud street noise

reviews.text: I was able to get a reasonable price through the hotel website when booking this room. The hotel is pretty much what I expected - nice room, a good size with everything very neat and clean. The bathroom was nice, with a large shower (with rain-type showerhead) and deep bath. Unfortunately I only checked in very late in the evening, so wasn't able to experience all the Hyatt had to offer.
reviews.title: Nice Room - clean and a good size

likes.disliked: — Area around the hotel can be a little seedy.

reviews.text: The hotel is a block away from Roxas Blvd and is about a 30 mintues drive from Makati (depending on traffic). At night, the area around the hotel is probably not the safest place (well, naturally it is Manila), but there are some bars close by that backpackers/locals/expats frequent that are good to have a drink at.
reviews.title: Love the Hyatt

reviews.text: One comment below that I read was in relation to the metal detectors at the entrance. For those unfamilar with Manila, they have these at most hotels and at all entrances to the Hyatt Hotel and Casino. The security are always very polite and aware of the surroundings and they realise that it is an inconvenience to visitors. They know who they are looking for and they are very good at remembering faces. Once they see you once or twice they make it easier to enter the hotel.
reviews.title: A Very Lovely Stay

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and quick with room service. The Hyatt is a nice change from the hussle and bussle of Manila.
reviews.title: Not up to scratch

reviews.text: Booked deluxe king room directly from web. Wonderful room - huge glassed in soaking tub and separate shower area including rain shower head. I spent at least an hour a day in there. 50 inch plazma tv, sitting area, and very comfortable bed. Don't know much about casinos but it had one and it seemed typical to me - all the usual games, free stuff if you are playing. Everyone is so nice and helpful there. Never had any kind of problem with anyone. I'm glad I stayed in old Manila vs. the newer Makati area. I really got a feel for the city. If you are the type that needs to be sheltered from the harsher realities of life, then Makati might be a better fit for you. It's nice and new and shiney. In Manila, you will walk down very crowded dirty streets, little naked street kids will beg you for change while rubbing their bellies indicating they are hungry, you'll be offered watches, old american collectible coins, viagra, very persistently (just smile, say no thank you and keeping walking). I made the trip a few blocks to Robinsons Galleria Mall every day and a few blocks in the other direction every night to the Baywalk and never once felt at risk for anything. But like anywhere else, be smart and stay alert. Be very careful crossing the streets, and try not to have a cornary when riding in a taxi, it doesn't look like it , but they do know what they are doing. Just let go. If you take a taxi from the Hyatt, security will write down the taxi's information and where you are going. Everything is so cheap there. Man, is it hot! I love the Hyatt and I love Manila and the people. I will return. If anyone would like more info from a single male's perspective traveling alone, e-mail me.
reviews.title: Very Dark and Bad Location

description: Hyatt Hotel and Casino Manila is a deluxe 5 star business hotel situated at the heart of Manila and in close proximity to the convention centers, shopping malls and historical attractions. Welcoming and spacious, the 376 guestrooms and suites are all designed with high ceilings and large windows to fully showcase the breath taking views of the Manila Bay sunset. Featuring four presidential suites where luxury and decadence meet, our full-time dedicated butlers attend to every smallest detail round the clock. Stay connected with free WiFi in our guest rooms and restaurants or while enjoying a leisurely afternoon by our poolside featuring a 25-m outdoor lap pool, children’s pool and Jacuzzi , all providing a tranquil escape from the bustle of Manila. Home to the award-winning restaurants in the city, enjoy perfectly prepared steaks at The Fireplace, authentic Cantonese delicacies at Li Li or visit Market Café for a truly international dining experience showcased through its live and interactive kitchens. Unwind at The Lounge over a refreshing cocktail or indulge at the Pastry Boutique offering a sinful selection of chocolates, pastries and cakes.Offering several leisure and entertainment facilities, pamper yourself with our signature treatments by visiting The Spa at Club Oasis or try your luck at the Casino-Filipino complete with two levels of executive floors studded with gaming and entertainment offerings. Choose from numerous event venues, tastefully appointed and fitted with technologically advanced equipment, making them an ideal setting for corporate meetings, weddings or any social events.
